answers.answer: Mine still runs a little high. I am usually around 130-150. I am 34 weeks and on Wednesday they said my amniotic fluid was too high due to the sugar levels so I will need to be induced soon. Will fine out when on next Wednesday. But I never had to start medications.... it's so frustrating,  especially when I eat what they tell me and it still does nothing!

I have it, I use insulin, the problem with me right now is, is not easy for me to follow a diet because I'm getting nauseous when I eat some stuff, so is getting hard for me, and blood sugar won't go up more than 150, what concerns me is that the fasting one is between 100-110 and it wasn't like that before I enter the 3 and half months, but I'm eating as healthy as I can, I try not to eat sweet stuff and nd no pasta or rice

Yes, diet worked well for me for awhile. Then when the glucose slowly increased I was started on oral meds with my last one. Very common as your progressing. This all with my last pregnancy. As soon as I had my sweet abbie my sugars were perfect if not a little low. Now that I'm expecting again my doctor is suggesting oral medication even before I'm having problems. Feeling much more on top of things this time around! Good luck!!

I hear yah. I am 29 1/2 weeks and I worry that is what they will say to me. I am following the diet exactly and they are still high. My fasting levels are between 119-132. Breakfast is usually around 125 lunch is always the highest... Yesterday it was 183 today it was 148 and dinner is around 130. I go back to the doctor on Tuesday to find out what the next step is. But I have my sonogram on Monday.....
Are you sugar levels ALWAYS really high or is there some meals higher than others?

Oh yeah, they would definitely put u on meds, is too high, some food makes it higher but the thing is that I have the same breakfast every day, and sometimes is higher than other days, but do like I used to do, I used to walk 10 mins after each meal, it will keep ur sugars low
Just took mine 2 hours after dinner and it was 171!!!!!!!! EGGGHHHHH
I've had my meds increased 3 times and I follow the diet.  I go to Dr tomorrow so I will see what he says.   Im almost 37 weeks.

They might have to put you on medication to help regulate your sugar levels more... I was diagnosed at week 29 and had to go on medication-- glyburide-- at around week 34... I had my baby yesterday and the hospital situation is scary.. they check your levels and baby's levels and if the baby's levels get too low they have to take them to the nicu and give them an iv for insulin... the threat of them taking my daughter to the NICU terrified me... I wanted to eexclusively breastfeed but she wasn't latching well, kept falling asleep and wasnt eating so I ended up giving her a couple bottles of formula so her sugars didn't get too low
Hoe many weeks were you when you gave birth? I've been worried about extra amniotic fluid... Did that happen to anyone? This is breaking me out. The more i read the worse itGets.

I was 38 weeks and 6 days... I was scheduled to be induced the day after I went into labor.... I didnt have any extra fluid or too low of fluid... my sugars were pretty well maintained with diet uo until I got sick 4 times in a row... my fasting levels went roo high so that's why they put me on the meds... when I was 35 weeks I had to go in twice a week for a BPP (biophysical profile) and stress test... the BPP is an ultrasound-- twice a week. ..  now that she is out, and healthy and happy, I don't have to worry too much about diet... I have to be checked for diabetes in 6 weeks to see if the GD turned into Type 2-- im really hoping not

Im dealing with it to stress also make ur sugar go up.. im scared cause i have to have another ultrasound to see how big she is. Im scared of being induce but if i have to for my baby girl i will...im 33 weeks and 5 days

I am 31 weeks and was diagnosed with Gestational diabetes since 9 weeks due to family history and my weight they tested early. Thank goodness so far everything has been diet and exercise control. No meds/no insulin. I've gained 5lbs. I try to walk after each meal around the block once or twice. It's not very physical,  but I feel at least I'm active and just not sitting.  I also try to eat as much free carbs as I can. Lots of salads,  lots of protein.  I do have days my numbers are high (over the recommend 2 hr fasting of 120) buy I've learned not to beat myself up and try again tomorrow. The constant pricking,  and stressing over numbers on the meter has consumed my whole life/pregnancy.  There may not be anything you can do, no matter how well you eat so try not to stress so much. It's just one of those things in pregnancy that may not be in our control no matter how hard we try.

question: Anyone else got diagnosed with Gestational Diabetes and following the diet and still having high sugar level readings?
title: Anyone Else?
